p: Viral hepatitis is the seventh leading cause of mortality globally. 1 A third of this mortality is attributed to hepatitis C virus (HCV), a major cause of acute viral hepatitis and liver fibrosis, cirrhosis, and cancer. 1, 2, 3, 4 In the Middle East and North Africa (MENA), HCV accounts for two thirds of viral hepatitis mortality and disability‐adjusted life years. 1, 4 Although exposure to HCV infection has been estimated at 1%‐3% in most countries, 2, 5 disproportionate infection levels are found in the MENA countries. 2, 3, 5, 6 In this region, antibody prevalence has reached high levels in populous countries, particularly in Egypt and Pakistan, at 10.0% 7, 8, 9, 10 and 4.8%, 11, 12, 13 respectively.
